column3: Compiling 8441c90 on macOS `10.14.2`: ``` ./autogen.sh && ./configure && make check -j6 ``` The option is disabled. However, when passing `-mmacosx-version-min=10.11` to `./configure`: ``` ./autogen.sh CXXFLAGS="-mmacosx-version-min=10
@fanquake: your right. There is something wrong with our implementation... I'll fix that soon.

Current macOS launch at login code does release an item which belongs to an array that gets release later (double release) which causes a crash on certain macOS versions.\n\nI added a commit that fixes the memory mismanagement.

tACK 35f5cb791de6bd47b62e031a74d885f00efd2585 (macOS 10.13.6 + Qt 5.11.2)

> The depends built binaries (Gitian) are not affected since we are building with min macOS 10.10.

Note: [official v0.17.1](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-0.17.1/bitcoin-0.17.1-osx.dmg) _is_ affected.
Could backport?

`CFLAGS="-mmacosx-version-min=10.11"` could be added as well.\nWithout `CFLAGS` there are linker warnings:\n![screenshot from 2019-01-21 11-38-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/51465744-376e5b80-1d71-11e9-8363-f167505cb535.png)
This function declaration seems unnecessary. Could it be removed?
`res` is a `bool` already. Could the comment be removed?
